[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
The ReversingLabs-CapabilitiesOverview workbook provides a high level look at your threat intelligence capabilities and how they relate to your operations.

| project ti_check","isHiddenWhenLocked":true,"timeContext":{"durationMs":0},"timeContextFromParameter":"timerange","queryType":0,"resourceType":"microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces","value":"false"},{"id":"ceca17f7-5260-4d12-99a3-25fe08b2b512","version":"KqlParameterItem/1.0","name":"ticloud_api_check","type":1,"query":"// check for RLTiCloudQuotas_CL table
// if sum equals 1, then table doesn't exist
// if sum eqals 2, then connection error exists
// any sum greater than 2 means API is working as expected
let RLTable = view (){     
    RLTiCloudQuotas_CL
        | where eventType_s == "connection_check"
        | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *)
        | extend x = iff(RLAPIConnectionStatus_s == "connected", 1, 0)
        | project x};
let RLTableErrorCheck = view (){ 
    RLTiCloudQuotas_CL
        | where eventType_s == "connection_check"
        | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *)
        | extend x = iff(RLAPIConnectionStatus_s == "error", 1, 0)
        | project x
};
let View_2 = view () { print x=1 };
union isfuzzy=true
(RLTable | where x > 0),
(RLTableErrorCheck),
(View_2)
| summarize sum(x)
| extend status=case(sum_x > 2, "error", sum_x == 2, "connected", "none")
| project status

"},"name":"text - 0"},{"type":12,"content":{"version":"NotebookGroup/1.0","groupType":"editable","items":[{"type":1,"content":{"json":"## Threat Intel Executive Summary"},"name":"text - 4"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"**You could be getting more from your Threat Intelligence feeds!**","style":"upsell"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"rl_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"false"},"name":"text - 8"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"The ReversingLabs Ransomware Intel Feed injects indicators curated specifically to hunt ransomware. Our indicators are harvested from confirmed malware and vetted for accuracy, enhanced with additional intel, and evaluated for activeness. This provides your Sentinel deployment with dynamic CTI to hunt ransomware in every stage of the ransomware lifecycle.

**Unlock the unlimited potential of Sentinel with an unmatched high-quality CTI dataset to protect your organization from ransomware**

- <ins>Ransomware Focused Intelligence</ins> - Indicators harvested from the +2.5 million confirmed, unique malware files analyzed every day producing a wealth of ransomware-related datasets.
- <ins>Focus on the Hunt</ins> - All indicators are enriched with metadata from the perceived vulnerability exploitation techniques, eliminating the need for manual technique identification and tagging.
- <ins>Lower Alert Fatigue</ins> - All indicators are strictly vetted and curated to ensure indicators are not only accurate but active within the last 30 days, eliminating false positives.
- <ins>Policy Driven by Intelligence</ins> - With indicators harvested from active, confirmed malware these indicators can be pushed to short-term policy with confidence.

**[Click here to view the ReversingLabs Ransomware Threat Intel Feed in the Azure Marketplace](https://azuremarketplace.microsoft.com/marketplace/apps/reversinglabs1597673283347.rw_feed_offer0?tab=Overview)**

**[Click here for more info on ReversingLabs' Threat Intelligence offerings](https://www.reversinglabs.com/products/file-reputation-service)**"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"rl_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"false"},"name":"text - 5"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"**Thank you for subscribing to the ReversingLabs threat intelligence feed!**","style":"success"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"rl_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"true"},"name":"text - 5 - Copy"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"Here's how to get the most benefit out of the feed:

- Enable analytic rules mapping threat intelligence indicators to your data sources
- Deploy playbooks that will automatically enrich your incidents
- Hunt for indicators in your environment"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"rl_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"true"},"name":"text - 7"}]},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"ti_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"true"},"name":"TI Executive Summary","styleSettings":{"showBorder":true}},{"type":12,"content":{"version":"NotebookGroup/1.0","groupType":"editable","items":[{"type":1,"content":{"json":"Threat intelligence is information about cyber threats (malware, ransomware, etc.) and threat actors that help identify malicious events. This information can be referred to as indicators of compromise (or IoC). It consists of objects such as IP addresses, file hashes, and URLs which can be used to identify an attack. Threat Feeds and Search/Query APIs automate processing, correlation, analysis, and threat status information gathering to enable orchestration to build the foundation of threat informed defense.

### Indicator quality

Use this table to check the overall quality of your existing threat intel feeds.
* **Active Indicators**: the total number of active indicators
* **Average Tags**: tags help provide add context indicators
* **Average Age**: stale indicators potentially lead to more false positives
* **Uniqueness Percentage**: this metric shows the percetnage of unique indicators in each of your feeds","style":"info"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"guide","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"Yes"},"name":"text - 1","styleSettings":{"padding":"5px"}},{"type":3,"content":{"version":"KqlItem/1.0","query":"let DomainQuery=view() { 
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(DomainName)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(DomainName) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="DomainEntry"
};
let UrlQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(Url)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(Url) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="UrlEntry"
};
let FileHashQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(FileHashValue)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(FileHashValue) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="FileHashEntry"
};
let IPQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(NetworkIP) or isnotempty(NetworkSourceIP)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(NetworkIP) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="IPEntry"
};
let EmailAddressQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSenderAddress)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(EmailSenderAddress) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="EmailAddressEntry"
};
let EmailMessageQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSubject)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(EmailSubject) by SourceSystem
| project SourceSystem, dcount_, EntryType="EmailMessageEntry"
};
let AllIndicators=view(){
    DomainQuery
    | union UrlQuery
    | union FileHashQuery
    | union IPQuery
    | union EmailAddressQuery
    | union EmailMessageQuery
    | summarize sum(dcount_) by SourceSystem
    | project SourceSystem, sum_dcount_
};
AllIndicators","size":3,"title":"Summary of TI Sources","noDataMessage":"You don't have any TI sources!","noDataMessageStyle":5,"timeContextFromParameter":"timerange","queryType":0,"resourceType":"microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces","crossComponentResources":["{workspace}"],"visualization":"piechart"},"customWidth":"50","name":"query - 2"},{"type":3,"content":{"version":"KqlItem/1.0","query":"// get average age of indicators in source
let AvgAge = ThreatIntelligenceIndicator 
| extend indicator_age = datetime_diff('day', now(), TimeGenerated)
| summarize round(avg(indicator_age)) by SourceSystem;
// get average number of tags per indicator
let tagCount = ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| extend iocTagCount = iff(isempty(array_length(todynamic(Tags))), 0, array_length(todynamic(Tags)))
| summarize round(avg(iocTagCount)) by SourceSystem;
// uniqueness
let DomainQuery=view() { 
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(DomainName)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by DomainName
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(DomainName) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="DomainEntry"
};
let UrlQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(Url)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by Url
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(Url) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="UrlEntry"
};
let FileHashQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(FileHashValue)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by FileHashValue
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(FileHashValue) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="FileHashEntry"
};
let IPQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(NetworkIP) or isnotempty(NetworkSourceIP)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by NetworkIP, NetworkSourceIP
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(NetworkIP) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="IPEntry"
};
let EmailAddressQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSenderAddress)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by EmailSenderAddress
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(EmailSenderAddress) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="EmailAddressEntry"
};
let EmailMessageQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSubject)
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by EmailSubject
| extend SourceSystemArray=array_sort_asc(SourceSystemArray)
| summarize dcount_=dcount(EmailSubject) by tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project SourceSystemArray, dcount_, EntryType="EmailMessageEntry"
};
let SingleSourceIndicators=view(){
    DomainQuery
    | union UrlQuery
    | union FileHashQuery
    | union IPQuery
    | union EmailAddressQuery
    | union EmailMessageQuery
    | where array_length(todynamic(SourceSystemArray))==1
    | summarize sum(dcount_) by SourceSystemArray
    | extend counter=1 
};
let MultipleSourceIndicators=view(){
    DomainQuery
    | union UrlQuery
    | union FileHashQuery
    | union IPQuery
    | union EmailAddressQuery
    | union EmailMessageQuery
    | where array_length(todynamic(SourceSystemArray))!=1
    | summarize sum(dcount_) by SourceSystemArray
    | extend counter=1
};
let CountOfActiveIndicatorsBySource=view(){
    ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
	| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
    | where ExpirationDateTime > now() and Active == true
    | summarize count() by SourceSystem
    | project SourceSystem, count_
    | extend IndicatorSource = SourceSystem
};
let UniquePercentage = view(){
    SingleSourceIndicators
    | join kind=fullouter MultipleSourceIndicators on counter 
    | extend uniquetotal=iff(SourceSystemArray1 contains tostring(todynamic(SourceSystemArray)[0]), sum_dcount_1 + sum_dcount_, sum_dcount_)
    | where SourceSystemArray1 contains todynamic(SourceSystemArray)[0] 
    | order by SourceSystemArray
    | extend solitary_count=sum_dcount_
    | summarize shared_count = sum(sum_dcount_1) by SourceSystemArray, solitary_count
    | extend total_count = shared_count + solitary_count
    | extend unique_percentage = round(toreal(solitary_count)/toreal(total_count)*100, 1)
    | extend IndicatorSource = tostring(todynamic(SourceSystemArray)[0])
    | union CountOfActiveIndicatorsBySource
    | summarize sum(unique_percentage) by IndicatorSource
    | extend sum_unique_percentage = iff(tolong(sum_unique_percentage) == 0, 100, tolong(sum_unique_percentage))
    | project IndicatorSource, UniquenessPercentage=sum_unique_percentage
};
// join on total count of indicators per source
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator 
| where Active == true
| summarize dcount(IndicatorId) by SourceSystem
| join AvgAge on SourceSystem
| join tagCount on SourceSystem
| join UniquePercentage on $left.SourceSystem == $right.IndicatorSource
| project ["Source Feed"]=SourceSystem, ["Total Active Indicators"]=dcount_IndicatorId, ["Avg. Tags"]=avg_iocTagCount, ["Avg. Age"]=avg_indicator_age, UniquenessPercentage

** Based on query of ThreatIntelligenceIndicator table over last 90 days.*","style":"error"},"name":"text - 0"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"### What is threat intelligence?
Threat intelligence is information about cyber threats (malware, ransomware, etc.) and threat actors that help identify malicious events. This information can be referred to as indicators of compromise (or IoC). It consists of objects such as IP addresses, file hashes, and URLs which can be used to identify an attack. Threat Feeds and Search/Query APIs automate processing, correlation, analysis, and threat status information gathering to enable orchestration to build the foundation of threat informed defense.

### Why implement a threat intelligence feed?

* âœ… **Less false positives:** using threat intelligence feeds with high quality, vetted indicators can help you filter out the noise and identify real threats in your environment.
* âœ… **Informed incident response:** quality threat intelligence feeds will contextualize indicators with information such as malware family and threat type, which allow defenders to quickly develop well-informed response activities. 
* âœ… **Competitive advantage:** Organizations that can effectively use threat intelligence to protect themselves from cyber attacks can gain a competitive advantage in their industry.

### Resources to learn how to get started with threat intelligence in Microsoft Sentinel:
* [Understand threat intelligence in Microsoft Sentinel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/understand-threat-intelligence?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#adding-threat-indicators-to-azure-sentinel-with-the-threat-intelligence---taxii-data-connector)
* [Connect Microsoft Sentinel to STIX/TAXII threat intelligence feeds](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-threat-intelligence-taxii)
* [ReversingLabs - Explainable Threat Intelligence Overview (YouTube)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s0N5oWxZdh4)
* [ReversingLabs - How to evaluate threat intelligence feeds (eBook)](https://www.reversinglabs.com/ebook/how-to-evaluate-threat-intelligence-feeds)"},"name":"text - 1"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"## See what you're misssing:

let DomainQuery=view() { 
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(DomainName)
| extend IndicatorValue=DomainName
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, Tags
};
let UrlQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(Url)
| extend IndicatorValue=Url
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, Tags
};
let FileHashQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(FileHashValue)
| extend IndicatorValue=FileHashValue
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, Tags
};
let IPQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(NetworkIP) or isnotempty(NetworkSourceIP)
| extend IndicatorValue=NetworkIP
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, NetworkSourceIP, Tags
};
let EmailAddressQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSenderAddress)
| extend IndicatorValue=EmailSenderAddress
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, Tags
};
let EmailMessageQuery=view(){
ThreatIntelligenceIndicator
| where TimeGenerated > ago(ioclookback)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IndicatorId
| where isnotempty(EmailSubject)
| extend IndicatorValue=EmailSubject
| summarize SourceSystemArray=make_set(SourceSystem) by IndicatorValue, Tags
};
let AllIndicators=view(){
    DomainQuery
    | union UrlQuery
    | union FileHashQuery
    | union IPQuery
    | union EmailAddressQuery
    | union EmailMessageQuery
};
// get alert IDs and entities where the alert query contains the ThreatIntelligenceIndicator table
let AlertIDs = SecurityAlert
| where TimeGenerated {timerange}
| extend Query_ = tostring(parse_json(ExtendedProperties).Query)
| extend OriginalQuery_ = tostring(parse_json(ExtendedProperties).OriginalQuery)
| where Query_ contains "ThreatIntelligenceIndicator" or OriginalQuery_ contains "ThreatIntelligenceIndicator"
| project TimeGenerated, SystemAlertId, Entities;
// query incidents that match AlertIDs value
SecurityIncident
| where TimeGenerated {timerange}
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend AlertIds = tostring(AlertIds)
| join AlertIDs on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
| extend entity = parse_json(Entities)[0]
| extend IndicatorValue = case(
    entity.Value!="", tostring(entity.Value),
    entity.Address!="", tostring(entity.Address),
    entity.Url!="", tostring(entity.Url),
    entity.DomainName!="", tostring(entity.DomainName),
    "")
| where Status == "Closed"
| join kind=inner AllIndicators on $left.IndicatorValue == $right.IndicatorValue
| summarize dcount(IncidentName) by Status, Classification, tostring(SourceSystemArray)
| project ["Incidents closed"]=dcount_IncidentName, Classification, FeedName=SourceSystemArray","size":3,"title":"Closed incident classifications by TI feed","timeContextFromParameter":"timerange","queryType":0,"resourceType":"microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces","crossComponentResources":["{workspace}"],"visualization":"table","gridSettings":{"formatters":[{"columnMatch":"Classification","formatter":18,"formatOptions":{"thresholdsOptions":"icons","thresholdsGrid":[{"operator":"==","thresholdValue":"TruePositive","representation":"3","text":"{0}{1}"},{"operator":"==","thresholdValue":"FalsePositive","representation":"Noisy","text":"{0}{1}"},{"operator":"==","thresholdValue":"Undetermined","representation":"question","text":"{0}{1}"},{"operator":"==","thresholdValue":"BenignPositive","representation":"warning","text":"{0}{1}"},{"operator":"Default","representation":"Blank","text":"{0}{1}"}],"compositeBarSettings":{"labelText":"","columnSettings":[{"columnName":"Classification","color":"blue"}]}}}]},"chartSettings":{"showLegend":true}},"customWidth":"50","name":"query - 8"}]},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"ti_feed_check","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"true"},"name":"TI incident summary","styleSettings":{"showBorder":true}}]},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"section","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"ti"},"name":"ti summary"},{"type":12,"content":{"version":"NotebookGroup/1.0","groupType":"editable","loadType":"always","items":[{"type":1,"content":{"json":"# ðŸ“Š Your Operations Summary"},"name":"text - 0"},{"type":12,"content":{"version":"NotebookGroup/1.0","groupType":"editable","items":[{"type":1,"content":{"json":"## Operations Executive Summary"},"name":"text - 4"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"Resolution of alerts with the help of actionable threat intelligence can improve the speed and accuracy of triage. Below you will find a summary of your environment's incidents and how a ReversingLabs Threat Intel feed combined with the ReversingLabs solution for Microsoft Sentinel can help take your operations to the next level.

### Summary of incidents
This line chart provides a summary of all incidents created over the selected time range, and how many of those incidents where created from Threat Intelligence indicators.


### Operational efficiency summary
See how playbooks from ReversingLabs impact your operational efficiency:

* **No Enrichment**: incidents that have not had any enrichment 
* **Enriched**: incidents that have been enriched with automation
* **Auto-triaged**: incidents that have been automatically worked via automation","style":"info"},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"guide","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"Yes"},"name":"text - 1"},{"type":3,"content":{"version":"KqlItem/1.0","query":"let AlertIDs = SecurityAlert
| extend Query_ = tostring(parse_json(ExtendedProperties).Query)

| where Query_ contains "ThreatIntelligenceIndicator" or OriginalQuery_ contains "ThreatIntelligenceIndicator"

let TIIncidents = SecurityIncident
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IncidentNumber
| mv-expand AlertIds

| join AlertIDs on $left.AlertIds == $right.SystemAlertId
| summarize dcount(IncidentName) by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| extend ["Number of incidents"] = dcount_IncidentName
| extend label = "TI"
| project TimeGenerated, ["Number of incidents"], label;
SecurityIncident
| summarize arg_min(TimeGenerated, *) by IncidentName
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| project TimeGenerated, ["Number of incidents"]=count_
| extend label = "All"

Select an option using the buttons on the right.","style":"info"},"customWidth":"50","conditionalVisibilities":[{"parameterName":"offer","comparison":"isEqualTo"},{"parameterName":"section","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"info"}],"name":"text - 7"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"# Reversinglabs Ransomware Intel Feed

```
I AM RANSOMWARE

I came in through your redacted and 
I have already communicated to my team that I'm in...  
now I wait.
It could be a day, it could be a month, 
but I am waiting for the moment when we're positioned 
for mass effect. 
The only thing that can stop what's happening is 
if one of my copies gets busted and gives up its code 
and my indicators get put into a list to watch out for.

Not worried about that, ain't too many creating that kind of info...
```

## Threat Actor Overview

Threat actors have significantly increased the complexity of their operations to the point where they're run like a business to ensure efforts are coordinated and efficient. They work tirelessly to create malicious code that hides in plain site and avoids modern detection methods and they're not going to initiate the final phase of attack until they're positioned to maximize their effectiveness.
This provides you with precious time that can be used to seek, identify, and remove ransomware waiting to be detonated.

## Solution Overview

Enter ReversingLabs Ransomware Intel Feed for the Sentinel TAXII data connector that injects indicators **curated specifically to hunt ransomware** into your Threat Intelligence blade. Our indicators are harvested from confirmed malware and vetted for accuracy, enhanced with additional intel, and evaluated for activeness. This provides your Sentinel deployment with dynamic CTI to hunt ransomware in every stage of the ransomware lifecycle.

**Unlock the unlimited potential of Sentinel with an unmatched high-quality CTI dataset to protect your organization from ransomware**
* Ransomware Focused Intelligence - Indicators harvested from the +2.5 million confirmed, unique malware files analyzed every day producing a wealth of ransomware-related datasets.
* Focus on the Hunt - All indicators are enriched with metadata from the perceived vulnerability exploitation techniques, eliminating the need for manual technique identification and tagging.
* Lower Alert Fatigue - All indicators are strictly vetted and curated to ensure indicators are not only accurate but active within the last 30 days, eliminating false positives.
* Policy Driven by Intelligence - With indicators harvested from active, confirmed malware these indicators can be pushed to short-term policy with confidence.

### View the ReversingLabs Ransomware Intel Feed in the Azure Marketplace here: [LINK](https://azuremarketplace.microsoft.com/marketplace/apps/reversinglabs1597673283347.rw_feed_offer0?tab=Overview)","style":"info"},"customWidth":"50","conditionalVisibilities":[{"parameterName":"offer","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"offer1"},{"parameterName":"section","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"info"}],"name":"text - 0"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"# TitaniumCloud API

TitaniumCloud is a threat intelligence solution providing up-to-date file reputation services, threat classification and rich context on over 10 billion goodware and malware files. Files are processed using ReversingLabs [File Decomposition Technology](https://www.reversinglabs.com/technology/active-file-decomposition). A powerful set of REST API query and feed functions deliver targeted file and malware intelligence for threat identification, analysis, intelligence development, and threat hunting services.


## OVERVIEW

TitaniumCloud Reputation Services are powerful threat intelligence solutions with up-to-date, threat classification and rich context on over 10 billion goodware and malware files. ReversingLabs does not depend on crowd-sourced collection, but instead curates the harvesting of files from software vendors and diverse malware sources. All files are processed using unique ReversingLabs File Decomposition Technology, combined with other dynamic and detection information, to provide industry reputation consensus. TitaniumCloud supports a powerful set of REST API query and feed functions that deliver targeted file and malware intelligence for threat identification, analysis, intelligence development, and hunting.

## Global File Reputation

TitaniumCloud continually processes goodware and malware files providing early intelligence about attacks before they infiltrate customer infrastructures. This visibility to threats â€œin-the-wildâ€ enables preparation for new attacks and quickly identifies the threat levels of new files as they arrive. TitaniumCloud enables more effective and efficient file analysis, development of better threat intelligence, and implementation of proactive threat hunting programs.

## Contact us to learn more about TitaniumCloud: [LINK](https://www.reversinglabs.com/contact-us)","style":"info"},"customWidth":"50","conditionalVisibilities":[{"parameterName":"offer","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"offer2"},{"parameterName":"section","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"info"}],"name":"text - 0 - Copy"},{"type":11,"content":{"version":"LinkItem/1.0","style":"list","links":[{"id":"7a3bd117-b6a5-47c4-aae1-dd22dbae0116","cellValue":"offer","linkTarget":"parameter","linkLabel":"Ransomware Intel Feed","subTarget":"offer1","style":"primary"},{"id":"6eaf2743-0db8-495f-95a1-cad9a980d3d9","cellValue":"offer","linkTarget":"parameter","linkLabel":"TitaniumCloud API","subTarget":"offer2","style":"primary"}]},"customWidth":"50","name":"links - 0"}],"exportParameters":true},"conditionalVisibility":{"parameterName":"section","comparison":"isEqualTo","value":"info"},"name":"moreinfo"},{"type":12,"content":{"version":"NotebookGroup/1.0","groupType":"editable","items":[{"type":1,"content":{"json":"# â˜ï¸ TitaniumCloud API Usage"},"name":"text - 0"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"Use this tab to monitor your TitaniumCloud API usage. Compose_unknown_reputation.inputs: Hash (@{items('For_each_-_File_hash_reputation')?['Algorithm']})@{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['query_hash']?['sha256']} Status @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['status']} Status Description The sample has not received a classification. It does not exist in the file reputation database, or there is no information on whether it is malicious or not.

inputs.name: classification_reason
inputs.value: the sample can be obtained from a trusted source, or it was unpacked from a file originating from a trusted source

inputs.name: classification_reason
inputs.value: the sample was classified by the ReversingLabs multi-scan algorithm based on aggregated antivirus scan results

inputs.name: classification_reason
inputs.value: the sample or its container are signed with a valid and trusted certificate

inputs.name: classification_reason
inputs.value: the sample was classified manually after an analysis

inputs.name: classification_reason
inputs.value: the sample is signed with a recognized whitelisted certificate

Compose_malicious_reputation.inputs: Hash (@{items('For_each_-_File_hash_reputation')?['Algorithm']}) @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['query_hash']?['sha256']} Status @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['status']} Status Description The sample was classified as malicious by ReversingLabs proprietary algorithms. This classification is reserved for high-accuracy heuristics and named threats, such as Emotet, Dridex and WannaCry. Threat severity is expressed through the threat level value on a scale of 1-5. The higher the value, the more severe the threat. Threat Name @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['threat_name']} Threat Level @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['threat_level']} Reason @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['reason']} - @{variables('classification_reason')} File Details @{variables('analysis_story')} Scanner Detection @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['scanner_match']} of @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['scanner_count']} scanners detected this file

Compose_known_reputation.inputs: Hash (@{items('For_each_-_File_hash_reputation')?['Algorithm']}) @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['query_hash']?['sha256']} Status @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['status']} Status Description The sample is presumed to be benign by ReversingLabs. The sample does not have any AV detections from trustworthy sources and it does not match any of our internal threat signatures. We recommend checking the trust factor of the sample. A low trust factor (4 or 5 on a scale of 0 to 5, with 0 being highest trust) indicates the source is not trusted. On the other hand, samples with high trust factor values (0, 1, or 2) come from prominent software vendors. Trust Factor @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['trust_factor']} Reason @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['reason']} - @{variables('classification_reason')} Details @{variables('analysis_story')}

Compose_suspicious_reputation.inputs: Hash (@{items('For_each_-_File_hash_reputation')?['Algorithm']}) @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['query_hash']?['sha256']} Status @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['status']} Status Description The sample is considered suspicious based on ReversingLabs classification algorithmâ€™s multi-level analysis. This file may be declared malicious or known at a later time when more reliable heuristics start detecting the file, when a threat specific signature is written, or any new information is received that changes its threat profile. Threat Name @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['threat_name']} Threat Level @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['threat_level']} Reason @{body('Parse_hash_reputation_JSON')?['rl']?['malware_presence']?['reason']} - @{variables('classification_reason')} Details @{variables('analysis_story')}
